intro: Pultenaea baeuerlenii, commonly known as the Baeuerlen's hakea, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features small, pea-like flowers that are usually pale yellow or greenish in color. Pultenaea baeuerlenii is often found in coastal and inland areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
